channel.title: Posts on James Sann
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on James Sann

item.title: Personal sites
item.description: The rise and fall and then rise again of the personal website is a beautiful thing. That little corner of the world to express yourself, without the bounds of industry pressure, without hiding behind paywalls, without giving your information away to another entity, to just divulge what interests you... it's incredibly calming. Working away on those personal sites with good doggos. Illustration by Drawkit Tim Berners-Lee always envisioned an open web and a personal site gives you the ultimate freedom of expression.
item.content:
The rise and fall and then rise again of the personal website is a beautiful thing. That little corner of the world to express yourself, without the bounds of industry pressure, without hiding behind paywalls, without giving your information away to another entity, to just divulge what interests you... it's incredibly calming.

Tim Berners-Lee always envisioned an open web and a personal site gives you the ultimate freedom of expression. For years, I've had a personal site in various incarnations that eventually fell to the wayside of microblogging platforms like Twitter & Instagram, etc... Life evolved too. I got married, had a son, and time became more precious than ever. However, despite all of this, it always felt like I was missing a purity and sense of self when not designing and building my own site from scratch. Those people that do struggle with a personal site know that feeling well.

My plan with this version of the site is to try and keep things brief and what interests me. There might be a very quick post about x or y on a topic I enjoy, a personal post, or I might want to express feelings on the design industry at large and my experiences working within agency and product realms. If I'm being honest though, it's less frequently going to be the latter. It's hard to think work 24/7, especially during a very difficult 2020. Also, time is precious these days in my life but what I do love most about personal sites are those little insights into the people behind the industry jargon. A peek behind their interests, what rounds them out as individuals.

So stay tuned, grab a coffee/beverage of choice, relax, and thanks for reading.

item.title: Noise Cancelling Headphones
item.description: Whether it's working in an open-plan office or working from home, noise cancelling headphones are almost a necessity for deep focus work. My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard! Checkmate... Remind me to thank John for a lovely weekend. My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard!
item.content:
Whether it's working in an open-plan office or working from home, noise cancelling headphones are almost a necessity for deep focus work.

My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard! Checkmate... Remind me to thank John for a lovely weekend. My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard!

This is a Heading 2 which might run over two lines and then what the hell are we to do huh?

My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard! Checkmate... Remind me to thank John for a lovely weekend. My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard!

This is a Heading 3 which might run over.

My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard! Checkmate... Checkmate... I gave it a cold? I gave it a virus. A computer virus. Yes, Yes, without the oops! Hey, take a look at the earthlings. Goodbye!

This is a Heading 4 which might run over.

Must go faster... go, go, go, go, go! Life finds a way. God creates dinosaurs. God destroys dinosaurs. God creates Man. Man destroys God. Man creates Dinosaurs. Remind me to thank John for a lovely weekend. Hey, you know how I'm, like, always trying to save the planet? Here's my chance.

This is a Heading 5 which might run over.

Yes, Yes, without the oops! You really think you can fly that thing? What do they got in there? King Kong? Must go faster. Hey, take a look at the earthlings. Goodbye! God help us, we're in the hands of engineers. So you two dig up, dig up dinosaurs?

This is a Heading 6 which might run over.

My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard! Checkmate... Remind me to thank John for a lovely weekend. My dad once told me, laugh and the world laughs with you, Cry, and I'll give you something to cry about you little bastard!

For 50 years, WWF has been protecting the future of nature. The world's leading conservation organization, WWF works in 100 countries and is supported by 1.2 million members in the United States and close to 5 million globally.

  2. Number 2

  • Number 3

  margin: 0 auto;

    color: rgba(var(--black), 0.55);
  }

  .backtotop {
    float: right;

}
